meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm so excited to dive into Moving Out 2, the latest installment in this ridiculous series that's all about delivering puns and platforming fun.

First off, let me just say that my cat, Mr. Whiskers, has no idea why I spend most of my day playing video games instead of, you know, taking care of him. But hey, someone's gotta review these games for the greater good!

Now, onto Moving Out 2! From what I gathered from those fancy-pants critics (looking at you, Slant Magazine and your 80 score!), this game is all about adapting to chaos and weird mash-ups of things. Yeah, sounds like my cat's hairballs after a particularly rambunctious morning. But in all seriousness, Moving Out 2 seems to have upped the ante on its predecessor by adding more clever new ideas and improved level design.

Metro GameCentral gave it a whopping 90 score, saying it's a superior multiplayer co-op sequel that maximizes its novel premise. I mean, who doesn't love maximizing things? Sounds like my cat when he discovers an open bag of treats – MAXIMUM JOY!

Meanwhile, TheSixthAxis had some mixed feelings, saying it's more of the same chaotic multiplayer action, but loses its way and gets too hard later on. Ah, sounds like trying to get Mr. Whiskers to do tricks – you think they'll work, but really, you're just getting frustrated!

GamingTrend thought Moving Out 2 innovates on its predecessor's foundation, providing a break from mainstream releases. Yeah, I need those breaks – usually when Mr. Whiskers decides to knock over my water glass for the hundredth time that day.

Push Square and GameSpew both agreed it's a great option for Overcooked-like co-op fun, with colourful presentation and cheeky humour. And who doesn't love a good "must-play" game?

Finally, GameGrin gave it an impressive 95 score, saying it's an enjoyable game with friends or family (but not so much when playing alone). Yeah, that sounds like my experience trying to play video games while Mr. Whiskers demands attention – it's all about the right audience!

In conclusion, Moving Out 2 seems like a wild ride full of puns, platforming fun, and multiplayer mayhem! As for me? I'm just happy to have made it through this review without losing my sanity (or Mr. Whiskers' treats).
